resources.string: Tutor
Welcome to Tic-Stack-Toe!
A game of strategy and memory.
Each player starts with some nesting stacks of pieces.
Two stacks of three for the Junior 3x3 game.\n Three stacks of four for the full-sized 4x4 games
Players place their pieces on the board to try to form a line to win.
Your move first.
Drag one of your stack pieces to the middle tile.
Except in a strict game, pieces dragged from the stacks can be placed over smaller pieces on the board.
In a strict game, this is only allowed if your opponent already has all but one of their pieces in line.
Drag the other large piece from the player stack to upper right corner.
You can move a piece already on the board to another empty space or place it over an existing smaller piece.
It is possible to expose a win for your opponent this way!
No peeking?
In a strict game, there is no peeking- once you touch a piece on the board you have to move it.
Drag the upper right piece to the lower middle tile to block your opponent.
Place a new piece from your stacks into the middle right tile.
Go for the Win!
Pick up the big lower middle piece, and place it over your opponent\'s middle left piece, getting three in a row!
Congratulations!
You won this match, and have finished the tutorial.
Play modes

You can play against
 * Friends on the same device
 * AIs of various difficulties
 * Friends or Anonymous strangers over the network
 . Either real-time
 . Or Turn-based at your leisure
Ranked Play
You can choose to play ranked games against an AI or someone over the network. The ELO ranking system is used, with a starting rank of 1200.
